action.content:
You are participating in a collaborative guessing game.
The goal is to find out whether this grid and another picture only I can see, are the same.
Please describe your grid first. Then, I will provide my description and we can ask each other questions about the grids to figure out whether they are the same. Now start your short grid description with "DESCRIPTION:" followed by the description. Do not add anything else. This is your grid:
▢ ▢ ▢ ▢ X
▢ ▢ ▢ X ▢
▢ ▢ X ▢ ▢
▢ X ▢ ▢ ▢
X ▢ ▢ ▢ ▢
DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with an "X" in the top right corner, moving diagonally down to the bottom left corner.

This is my DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with an "X" in the top right corner, moving diagonally down to the bottom left corner.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any other symbols in your grid besides the "X" and empty squares?

This is my DESCRIPTION: A 5x5 grid with an "X" in the top right corner, moving diagonally down to the bottom left corner.
QUESTION: Are there any other symbols in your grid besides the "X" and empty squares? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Is there a row or column in your grid that has more than one "X"?

ANSWER: No
QUESTION: Is there a row or column in your grid that has more than one "X"? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any empty squares in your grid that are not part of the diagonal line of "X"s?

ANSWER: No
QUESTION: Are there any empty squares in your grid that are not part of the diagonal line of "X"s? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any empty squares in your grid that are adjacent to each other (horizontally or vertically)?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Are there any empty squares in your grid that are adjacent to each other (horizontally or vertically)? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any empty squares in your grid that are directly above or below an "X"?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Are there any empty squares in your grid that are directly above or below an "X"? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.
Now ask a question in order to find out new aspects of my grid that may be different to your grid. Start with "QUESTION:" and do not add anything else.
QUESTION: Are there any empty squares in your grid that are directly to the left or right of an "X"?

ANSWER: Yes
QUESTION: Are there any empty squares in your grid that are directly to the left or right of an "X"? Start your answer with "ANSWER:" and do not add anything else.

Now come to a decision. What do you think: are your grid and the other grid described the same?  Write "DECISION: same grid" if you think they are the same grid or "DECISION: different grids" if you think they are different grids. Do not add anything else.
